meanings.definition: In a subsidiary manner or role.
meanings.sent1: She helped out subsidiarily by organizing the files.
meanings.sent2: The assistant manager works subsidiarily to support the main manager.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to act subsidiarily by pretending to be the boss of the house.
meanings.sent4: The sun shone subsidiarily through the clouds, casting a gentle glow.
meanings.sent5: The student's role was subsidiarily to assist the teacher in the classroom.

meanings.definition: In a secondary or subordinate way.
meanings.sent1: He spoke subsidiarily during the meeting, adding a few comments.
meanings.sent2: The backup generator kicked in subsidiarily when the power went out.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel acted subsidiarily by trying to lead the parade of animals.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room subsidiarily, bringing warmth to all.
meanings.sent5: The extra chairs were placed subsidiarily around the main table for the guests.
